SENTENCE.STRING: (born in 1949), is a Palestinian professor of philosophy and president of the Al-Quds University in Jerusalem (Al Quds is the Arabic name for Jerusalem).
was also, until December 2002, the representative of the Palestinian National Authority in Jerusalem.

was born in Sheikh Jarrah, East Jerusalem to the politician Anwar Nusseibeh and Nuzha Al Ghussein, descended from Palestine's wealthy landed aristocracy and daughter of Palestinian political leader Yaqub al-Ghusayn.
has a Ph.D. in Philosophy, from Harvard University (1978).
and Ami Ayalon are the co-founders of The People's Voice, an Israeli-Palestinian civil initiative that aims to advance the process of achieving peace between Israel and the Palestinians.

is head and founder of the Palestinian Consultancy Group, co-founder and member of several Palestinian institutions including the Jerusalem Friends of the Sick Society, the Federation of Employees in the Education Sector in the West Bank, the Arab Council for Public Affairs, the Committee Confronting the Iron Fist, and the Jerusalem Arab Council.
is also on the advisory board of The International Center for Ethics, Justice and Public Life at Brandeis University.
publications include numerous articles and, with Mark Heller, No Trumpets, No Drums: A Two-State Solution of the Israeli- Palestinian Conflict, New York: Hill & Wand, 1991.
